problem.markdown:
Mini Quiz (not graded) - Introduction to DHIS2/History
====
>>DHIS 2 can be used as a ‘data warehouse’ to store data from multiple data sources in one location<< (x) True ( ) False
[explanation] DHIS 2 can combine data from multiple data sources. This includes through routine data that is directly collected within the system you are working as well as supplementary data from other sources such as surveys. [explanation]
>>The HISP network works collaboratively on advancing the features which DHIS 2 supports<< (x) True ( ) False
[explanation] The HISP network is a world-wide collaboration that supports the development of the DHIS 2 project. Collaboration between the nodes is a key area of interest to ensure that DHIS 2 continues to meet local needs as defined by its users. [explanation]
problem.p: Mini Quiz (not graded) - Introduction to DHIS2/History
DHIS 2 can be used as a ‘data warehouse’ to store data from multiple data sources in one location

choicegroup.label: DHIS 2 can be used as a ‘data warehouse’ to store data from multiple data sources in one location

div.p: DHIS 2 can combine data from multiple data sources. This includes through routine data that is directly collected within the system you are working as well as supplementary data from other sources such as surveys.

problem.p: The HISP network works collaboratively on advancing the features which DHIS 2 supports

choicegroup.label: The HISP network works collaboratively on advancing the features which DHIS 2 supports

div.p: The HISP network is a world-wide collaboration that supports the development of the DHIS 2 project. Collaboration between the nodes is a key area of interest to ensure that DHIS 2 continues to meet local needs as defined by its users.
